title: OCSO seeking wanted teen
content:
The Okaloosa County Sheriff’s Office is searching for a Shalimar teenager who is wanted for attempted homicide in connection with a June 9 shooting that injured four people at a townhome complex on Landview Drive, according to a release from the department.
The OCSO is asking for the public’s help in locating 15-year old Mikeal Lamar Johnson-Carter, who was last known to live at 41 11th Street in Shalimar.
Johnson-Carter is considered armed and dangerous.
Anyone with information on his whereabouts is asked to call the Okaloosa County Sheriff’s office at 850-651-7400 or contact Emerald Coast Crime Stoppers at 850-863-TIPS, emeraldcoastcrimestoppers.com or text “TIP214 PLUS YOUR MESSAGE” to CRIMES (274637).
If your information to Crime Stoppers helps lead to his capture, you could earn a cash reward of up $3,000 and you never have to give your name.
